intro: Peiranisia bahamensis, commonly known as the Bahamian peiranisia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly the Bahamas. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth, glossy surface. Peiranisia bahamensis is adapted to coastal environments and is often found in sandy soils along the shorelines of the Bahamas.
